LJCCollectionLib.summary: Contains Classes to represent a Collection.

LJCCollectionBase.remarks:
The LJCCollectionBase class provides the code that can be inherited to create a strongly typed Collection.

It accomplishes this by implementing IteratorAggregate which provides "foreach" functionality and Countable which provides "count" functionality.

A strongly typed collection class would extend (inherit) from this base class and add an AddObject() method that would require the strongly typed object collection element. This is what makes the collection strongly typed.

The strongly typed collection class would also provide a Retrieve() method that could retrieve the internal array element by key.

For an example of how this works, see class: LJCDBAccessLib-LJCDbColumns. Use this code to include the Collection lib classes.

AddItem.summary: Adds an object and key value.
AddItem.param: The object to be added to the collection.

DeleteItem.summary: Remove the item by Key value.
DeleteItem.param: Indicates if an error should be thrown if the key is not found.

RetrieveIndex.returns: The object at the index parameter.

RetrieveItem.summary: Retrieves the item by Key value.
RetrieveItem.param: Indicates if an error should be thrown if the key is not found.
RetrieveItem.returns: The object with the matching key value.

HasKey.summary: Indicates if a key already exists.
HasKey.returns: True if the key already exists, otherwise false.
